meanings.definition: A type of horse-drawn carriage used in Russia.
meanings.sent1: The tarantas rattled along the cobblestone road.
meanings.sent2: The villagers admired the ornate tarantas as it passed by.
meanings.sent3: The tarantas decided to take a detour through the meadow, much to the surprise of the passengers.
meanings.sent4: The tarantas carried dreams and hopes of a new beginning for the young couple.
meanings.sent5: The shiny tarantas gleamed under the bright sun, a symbol of elegance and tradition.

meanings.definition: A fast-paced and lively folk dance.
meanings.sent1: The dancers moved gracefully to the rhythm of the tarantas.
meanings.sent2: The festival came alive with the energetic sounds of the tarantas.
meanings.sent3: The tarantas challenged the dancers to keep up with its lively beat.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room as she twirled in the tarantas.
meanings.sent5: The tarantas swept everyone off their feet, filling the air with joy and excitement.

meanings.definition: A type of Russian folk music typically played at weddings.
meanings.sent1: The wedding procession was accompanied by the joyful tunes of the tarantas.
meanings.sent2: Guests clapped and sang along to the traditional tarantas melodies.
meanings.sent3: The tarantas seemed to have a mind of its own, setting the pace for the celebration.
meanings.sent4: The music of the tarantas wove a magical atmosphere around the newlyweds.
meanings.sent5: The sweet notes of the tarantas lingered in the air, creating memories that would last a lifetime.
